thread.title: Iowa City native Nate Wieland committed to Kirk Ferentz and
thread.title_full: Iowa City native Nate Wieland committed to Kirk Ferentz and

author: rivals.com
title: Iowa City native Nate Wieland committed to Kirk Ferentz and
text:
Iowa City native Nate Wieland committed to Kirk Ferentz and the Hawkeyes today. After landing an offer from Iowa this past week, Iowa City native Nate Wieland has verbally committed to the hometown Hawkeyes. The 6-foot-3, 220-pound Wieland announced his decision today after taking his official visit to the University of Iowa over the weekend.
"The visit this weekend really impressed me and it's just too good to turn down," said Wieland. "Being a hometown kid, it's just what you dream of."
Prior to the weekend, Wieland was verbally committed to Northern Illinois as a quarterback, but now will be staying home to play linebacker for the Hawkeyes.
"It feels really great," Wieland said. "I'm really excited for the future as a Hawkeye."
Very excited to announce that I am committing to the University of Iowa to further my football and academic career #Swarm17 üê§ pic.twitter.com/mYIwpSE6sC
‚Äî Nate Wieland (@NateWieland) January 30, 2017 Wieland is commitment No. 16 for the Iowa Hawkeyes in the Class of 2017.
A quarterback in high school, Wieland completed 110 of 196 pass attempts for 1,671 yards and 9 touchdowns for City High this past season. On the ground, he finished with 129 carries for 741 yards and 11 touchdowns.
See highlights from Wieland's senior year at City High in the video below.
